title: Inconsistent concretization with `packages:: {}` vs no package preferences at all

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Using spack@develop (commit id 1602b7a56192c23fb7fc110a1c8a17ec0837bdd3):

**/etc/spack/packages.yaml**
```
packages:
  pkgconf:
    version: [1.6.3]
```

**spack.yaml (respect existing package preferences)**
```
spack:
  view: false
  specs:
  - gcc@7.3.0+strip
```

The environment above concretizes to:
```
$> spack concretize -f
...
    ^pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@7.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
...
```

Now, if I add `packages:: {}` to `spack.yaml` so that it will concretize without respecting any existing package preferences:
**spack.yaml (ignore all existing package preferences)**
```
spack:
  packages:: {}
  view: false
  specs:
  - gcc@7.3.0+strip
```

... it will concretize like this:
```
$> spack concretize -f
...
  ^pkg-config@0.29.2%gcc@7.5.0+internal_glib arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
...
```

The issue is: the way the environment concretizes with `packages:: {}` is not the same as it concretizes when there is just no packages.yaml at all (and no override in the environment):
```
$> spack concretize -f
...
  ^pkgconf@1.7.3%gcc@7.5.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
...
```
